Procedural_Stage: Appeal from Trade-Marks Opposition Board decision
Evidence_Assessment: Respondent's extensive use and reputation; Applicant's insufficient evidence to rebut findings
Burden_of_Proof: On the Applicant to show no likelihood of confusion
Legal_Rule: Test for confusion based on first impression and imperfect recollection
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness and defensibility under the facts and law
Grounds_for_Claim: Similarity in bird designs and use of 'OUTFITTER'; potential consumer confusion
Outcome_on_Merits: Registration refused due to likelihood of confusion
Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of the marks, length of use, nature of wares/services, degree of resemblance
Defendant_Response: Opposition based on likelihood of confusion with 'AMERICAN EAGLE OUTFITTERS'
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of use and reputation
Remedy_Sought: Judicial review of Opposition Board decision
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under s. 56 of the Trade-Marks Act
Legal_Provision: s. 6(5), s. 56 of the Trade-Marks Act
Governing_Rule: Factors under s. 6(5) of the Trade-Marks Act for confusion
